intro: Urospatha angusta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and striking inflorescence. The plant produces a starchy underground stem, which is used as a food source in some regions. Its growth habit includes rhizomes that spread horizontally beneath the soil surface. Urospatha angusta is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its edible properties.
